intro: Neolitsea novoguinensis, commonly known as the New Zealand laurel, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a small evergreen tree or shrub that typically grows to a height of 3–5 meters. The plant has simple, ovate to elliptic leaves that are glossy and dark green on top and paler underneath. Its small, fragrant flowers are usually white or pale yellow and appear in clusters. The fruit is a small, woody capsule that splits open to release the seeds.
